item.title: Cap Size Guide
item.description: The Mentalab Explore system was designed to meet the needs of any researcher. As such, we provide a range of caps that can fit on large adults and babies. Here is our size guide. Cap Size Head Circumference XS 36-42 cm S/XS 39-45 cm S 42-48 cm M 48-54 cm L 54-60 cm XL 60-66 cm

item.title: EEG Pre-Experiment Checklist
item.description: We strongly recommend completing this checklist before you start collecting EEG data. This will ensure you get the best out of your Explore system. 1. Install Software Install appropriate software for your needs. An overview of our open-srouce APIs can be found on the software page of our website or in our GitHub Repo. Regardless which software you use to record with, you will need explorepy to verify impedances. To download explorepy, please consult our explorepy Installation Guide, or download our Windows installer.

item.title: Dry Electrode Guide
item.description: Dry Electrodes Types Mentalab currently offers three types of dry electrodes. Flat Electrodes For electrode positions not covered by hair (e.g. on the forehead, mastoid…), our flat electrodes ensure optimal skin contact and comfort. Brush Electrodes For areas covered in hair, we recommend using brush electrodes. Their flexible pins penetrate most hair types and establish good contact with the scalp. XL Brush Electrodes For very dense and curly hair types, we recommend using our XL brush electrodes for increased hair penetration.

item.title: LED Light Guide
item.description: The Mentalab Explore device was designed to provide maxmimum flexibility, with minimal size. This page lists how the device communicates with the user via the LED Diode. LED Light Blinking Pattern Description Red / Yellow / Green Solid at device start-up. Flashes for 3 secs Start-up in progress. Colour indicates battery status. Blue Blinks twice a second Bluetooth visible and advertising.

item.title: Button Command Guide
item.description: The Mentalab Explore device was designed to provide maxmimum flexibility, with minimal size. This page lists how the user can communicate with the device using the button. Action State Effect Single click Device off Device will turn on Double click Memory full (LED blinking pink) Delete flash memory. Return to advertising mode. Double click Device in startup Skip advertising.

item.title: Improving Impedances
item.description: Since the impedance at the REF electrode affects signal quality for all EEG channels, we recommend starting with the REF electrode. General Always verify that there is good contact between electrode and scalp. Ensure all electrodes are being pulled into the scalp by the cap and there are no creases in the cap causing electrodes to “float. Gel Electrodes Apply conductive gel through the openings at the back of the electrodes with a blunt syringe.

item.title: explorepy Command Guide
item.description: Mentalab’s flagship API, explorepy is written in Python. It is the most direct way to communicate with your Explore device. An overview of common command line inputs is listed below. For more information on explorepy, please refer to the docs. Action Command Line Input Data acquisition explorepy acquire -n Explore_XXXX Record data explorepy record-data -n Explore_XXXX Push data to lsl explorepy push2lsl -n Explore_XXXX Convert a binary file to csv explorepy bin2csv -f input_file.

item.title: Cleaning, Disinfecting and Storing Mentalab Hardware
item.description: While regularly disinfecting materials prevents contamination, please bear in mind that frequent disinfection will damage your equipment. If your equipment does not require immediate disinfection, consider using water-based cleaning. Cleaning Electrodes and Caps Please clean caps and electrodes immediately after every use to prevent conductive gel residue from drying into the material. Electrodes Clean electrodes with warm water and a soft material such as cotton or cotton swabs. Ensure that the connector always remains dry.
